threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Making this thread to make a definitive timeline of what happened in the scarlet and violet story, without any possible contradictions.
The professors are obsessed with the past and future, and want to make a time machine that brings those Pokémon into the present day.
This technology is way ahead of the time, but the professors discover the crystals in Area Zero. This allows them to create much better technology like a realistic AI and a time machine. I the professors test the time machine by sending Pokémon from the past or future to an arbitrary point in years ago. They observed that people from 100 years ago created the scarlet and violet books, and the professors consider this proof that the time machine actually works. The professor then proceeded to send these Pokémon to the present date. This work is incredibly secretive, and so everyone assumes that the score of the invalid books always existed, and that those expositions were just crazy people, just like the professors. The story of the games follow.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Welcome to the Raidcat Perrserker Zone aka 6 Star Tera Raid Meta Thread

Old Thread: >>52309465

>lol I can solo 5 star raids I don't need your ugly cat
6 stars are infinitely harder than 5 and extremely annoying. You can do them the normal way and risk wasting your time, or accept the raidcat as your raid savior.

>What's the meta?
4 Perrserkers. Their Hidden Ability stacks multiplicatively and, if you follow the flowchart, you can one-shot most raids.

>What's the raidcat like?
Perrserker @ Lum Berry
Level 100
Ability: Steely Spirit (Hidden Ability)
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 Speed (Host) or HP (Joiner)
Adamant Nature
- Iron Head
- Screech
- Swords Dance
- Taunt (Host) / Helping Hand (Joiner)

>Host? Joiner?
There's a small difference in strategy whether you are hosting or joining a raid. See pic.

>Alright so what's the fucking flowchart
Check the OP pic.

The host can also specify some different flowcharts to adapt to the boss raidmon

>Does this work every time?
No, but it's one of the only consistent strategies that you can follow. It's not great against Pokemon that have strong and/or STAB Fire/Fighting/Ground moves, and if their Tera resists Steel it can also take a few more turn (but still doable). Even if you don't get the OHKO, the raidmon should be extremely chunked and from then on just raid normally.

>How to get cat with HA?
Language Teacher sidequest, then use an Ability Patch to change its ability. Patch is an 11% drop from 6 Star Raids.

>I tried breeding but I'm getting Kantonian Meowth...
Make the G-Meowth hold an Everstone

>wtf I did that but none of them have Steely Spirit
G-Meowth's HA is Unnerve, it becomes Steely Spirit upon evolution.

If anyone asks questions that are answered in the OP or in the OP pic, call them stupid.

Use this thread to trade for raidcats, to organize (raidcat) raids, or just to discuss and ask questions about raids in general.

If it's not the former, then it's sure as fuck not the latter, and the most likely case is just that it's a giant ground lizard they designed as such because it sells the theme of dichotomy between land and sea, and didn't have any base animal in mind.
>To me, it seems like poor plotting, game design, and a lack of creativity to come up with something more appropriate for the region.
I really don't see what having legendaries that don't explicitly tie into the region's loose basis have to do with laziness. It could've been done or a whole host of reasons. Even discounting the fact that legends that don't specifically fit into a region's "basis" has been commonplace since Sinnoh, It's not like Lugia fit particularly well into Johto's pantheon either. It was epxlicitly designed for a movie and as a result comes across as an afterthought in lore compared to Ho-Oh, who had a dedicated building and also tied into the origin of the lesser legendaries. It simply seems like you're letting your dislike of the game/GF as a whole mixed with nostalgia cloud your judgement on the Quartet.

threads.sub: Showderp: The Banning of Anon edition
threads.com:
Champ and Finchinator lived alone in a small house on a hill.
Champ kept to himself, making memes and playing with his Pokemon, as Finchinator watched Smogon broadcasts on the television.
Life was simple, and they were both happy. That was, until the day Finchinator heard a voice from above.
“Your metagame has become corrupted by offense. It needs to be saved.”
“I will do my best to save it, Landorus,” Finchinator replied, rushing into Champ's room, removing all that beat stall from his life.
Again the voice called to Finch, "OU's health is still corrupt. It needs to be cut off from all that is offensive in this world, and return to stall."
“I will follow your instructions, Landorus. I have faith in thee,” Finchinator replied, as he shadowbanned Champ from the chat, away from the retarded oppos of the world.
One last time, Finchinator heard the voice of Landorus calling to him.
“You've done as I've asked, but I still question your devotion to me. To prove your faith, I will ask one more thing of you."
"Yes Landorus, anything!” Finchinator begged.
"To prove your love and devotion, I require a sacrifice. The /vp/ poster, Champ, will be this sacrifice. Go into his room, and ban him from Showdown, as an offering to me to prove you love me above all else."
"Yes Landorus", he replied, grabbing Toxapex's Pokeball from his bag.
Champ, watching through a crack in his door, trembled in fear.
Scrambling around his room to find a hiding place, he noticed a trap door to Dogars hidden under his rug.
Without hesitation, he flung open the hatch, just as Finchinator burst through his door, and threw himself down into the unknown depths below.

It made for a very lopsided experience, where I had to fight several bosses underleveled, although that was really fun, some bosses were around my team's levels, and then several of them stood no chance against any one of my Pokemon.
Still, I'm curious what you guys did.
